sentence.text: ` Are you giving me the sack ? "
That 's a note he got from the Editor the other day , giving him the sack . "
I had to take time off work , which did n't go down too well with the furniture store which employed me , and I was promptly given the sack .
` She thinks he ought to be given the sack , but Mr Potter wo n't hear of it .
And if they did give you the sack you would be walked away to the army I expect .
` I 'd better be getting back or the foreman will be giving me the sack . "
It went to his head and the superintendents were terrors and they could get rid of a man -- give him the sack like slap on their wrist .
If you want our marriage to have any chance of success you 'd better give her the sack first thing on Monday morning ! "
` You 're giving me the sack -- Sir ? " she said with contempt .
Mrs Bosanquet might also have mentioned , without stretching the point too far , the wonderful convenience of being able to give these troublesome boys the sack at a moment 's notice .
And he got the sack so the firm came on strike .
` Then Oxfam ; have you ever heard of anyone getting the sack from Oxfam ?
Basil got the sack and next we heard Basil was trying to capture Rommel with Lord Lovatt 's son .
SUPERSTAR Michael Caine got the sack from his first job in the movie business -- after being caught smoking in the loo .
A CHEEKY vicar got the sack -- for demanding a poll tax rebate during council prayers .
A JUDGE was forced to scrap a lengthy criminal trial after a woman juror claimed she had been threatened with the sack .
THOUSANDS of Post Office workers face the sack , union officials claimed last night .
